page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY} The area is dominated by{Bredon Hill} and the romans had a signal station on the summit. An{Iron Age fort}was the scene of a massacre and extensive earthworks indicate its importance. {The Benedictine Abbey of Holy Cross } was founded over 1,000 years ago and contains some of the finest examples of Norman architecture in England. The Abbey church survived the Reformation but the abbey buildings were destroyed and the stone found its way into many local buildings. During the{Civil War}the town switched its allegiance from King to Parliament as the circumstances dictated. The town bridge was blown up by the Royalists as they retreated. William Joyce of{'Lord Haw Haw'}fame, lived in the High Street and ran an office for the{British Fascist Movement.}
